html: Last week @HouseDemocrats passed the Paycheck Fairness Act. It will: Prohibit reliance on salary history for future pay. Employers must prove pay disparities are job-related. Barring retaliation against women who reveal wages. #EqualPayDay #PaycheckFairnessAct
text:
Last week @HouseDemocrats passed the Paycheck Fairness Act. It will: 

 Prohibit reliance on salary history for future pay. 
 Employers must prove pay disparities are job-related. 
 Barring retaliation against women who reveal wages. 

#EqualPayDay
#PaycheckFairnessAct

BECAUSE

When workers have more money in their pockets, they spend it

AND

text:
I want to highlight the life of the Honorable Bill Gray. He was the 1st African-American to serve as Whip. He was dedicated to Philly and its surrounding regions, & I am grateful for his work and for inspiring so many, like myself & my friend @RepDwightEvans.

#BlackHistoryMonthpic.twitter.com/ZbW0L6GLpy

text:
It was an emotional night for my @HouseDemocrats colleagues & me. After 11 hours, we passed #HR8 & #HR1112 out of @HouseJudiciary. They are the first gun violence prevention bills *in decades* to get out of committee. I look forward to their passage in the House.

#EndGunViolence

html: Unlike pharmacies and other businesses that sell dangerous products, most gun stores in America aren’t required to secure their firearms outside of business hours. text:
Unlike pharmacies and other businesses that sell dangerous products, most gun stores in America aren’t required to secure their firearms outside of business hours. The result: guns are stolen, trafficked, and used in crimes. 

This is a fixable problem.https://www.newyorker.com/news/news-desk/why-thieves-target-gun-stores …

html: So let me get this straight. - On Dec. 19, Senate passes a short-term CR funding the gov. until Feb. 8 - Trump demands $5 billion for a wall. - In his last act of cowardice, @SpeakerRyan doesn't bring the Senate bill up, and instead brings one up with wall money. - We shut down.
text:
So let me get this straight.

- On Dec. 19, Senate passes a short-term CR funding the gov. until Feb. 8
- Trump demands $5 billion for a wall.
- In his last act of cowardice, @SpeakerRyan doesn't bring the Senate bill up, and instead brings one up with wall money.
- We shut down.

html: Finally, 4) Our bipartisan #PFAS Task Force will work to pass more robust funding that prioritizes remediation and ensuring that Americans exposed to PFAS, including our country's veterans, get the health care and support they need.
text: Finally, 4) Our bipartisan #PFAS Task Force will work to pass more robust funding that prioritizes remediation and ensuring that Americans exposed to PFAS, including our country's veterans, get the health care and support they need.

html: 3) Our bipartisan #PFAS Task Force will meet with congressional leadership and committee chairs, on both sides of the aisle, to ensure PFAS clean-up is getting the adequate attention it deserves in this new Congress.
text: 3) Our bipartisan #PFAS Task Force will meet with congressional leadership and committee chairs, on both sides of the aisle, to ensure PFAS clean-up is getting the adequate attention it deserves in this new Congress.

html: 2) Our bipartisan #PFAS Task Force will continue to propose legislation to address PFAS contamination, including a national #PFAS environmental standard & urging the @DeptofDefense to more urgently clean-up hundreds of military sites with identified PFAS chemical contamination.
text: 2) Our bipartisan #PFAS Task Force will continue to propose legislation to address PFAS contamination, including a national #PFAS environmental standard & urging the @DeptofDefense to more urgently clean-up hundreds of military sites with identified PFAS chemical contamination.

html: What will our bipartisan #PFAS Task Force do this Congress? Several key initiatives: 1) We'll hold informational events for Members of Congress, Capitol Hill staff and communities impacted to increase awareness about PFAS chemicals. (cont.)

html: Eight years ago, Congresswoman Gabby Giffords was nearly killed in Tucson, and six others lost their lives. Since then, we’ve seen many more communities torn apart by gun violence. Congress must act, starting with today's Bipartisan Background Checks Act. #Gunsense #GunSafetyNow
text:
Eight years ago, Congresswoman Gabby Giffords was nearly killed in Tucson, and six others lost their lives. Since then, we’ve seen many more communities torn apart by gun violence. Congress must act, starting with today's Bipartisan Background Checks Act.

#Gunsense #GunSafetyNow
